text: The Commission has examined the meaning and scope of Article 27 para. 1 (b) (Art. 27-1-b) of the Convention.

text: It considers that the term "another procedure" refers to judicial or quasi-judicial proceedings similar to those set up by the Convention.
label: premise

text: Moreover, the term "international investigation or settlement" refers to institutions and procedures set up by States, thus excluding non-governmental bodies.

text: The Commission considers that the Inter-Parliamentary Union constitutes a non-governmental organisation, whereas Article 27 para. 1 (b) (Art. 27-1-b) refers to inter-governmental institutions and procedures.

text: It follows that the procedures of the Inter-Parliamentary Union do not constitute "another procedure of international investigation or settlement" within the meaning of Article 27 para. 1 (b) (Art. 27-1-b) of the Convention.

text: Article 3 (Art. 3) of the Convention states:
label: non-argumentative

text: "No one shall be subjected to torture or to inhuman or degrading treatment or punishment."
label: non-argumentative

text: According to the Convention organs' case-law, ill-treatment within the meaning of Article 3 (Art. 3) of the Convention must attain a certain minimum level of severity, if it is to fall within the scope of this provision.
label: non-argumentative
